A

active() - Static method in class Point
Active method that returns the number of active instances that are present while execution of the program

D

distance(double, double) - Method in class Point
Instance method named Distance that calculates the distance between the two points created.
distance(double, double, double, double) - Static method in class Point
Class method named Distance that basically calculates the distance between the two points entered as parameters in the method

G

Getter method that returns the x coordinate of the point
getY() - Method in class Point

I

id - Static variable in class Point
 

M

move(double, double) - Method in class Point
SHifts the x and y coordinates of the point according to the value specified by the user

P

Point - Class in Unnamed Package
Point class that initializes the x and y coordinates of the point with the given values as obtained from the user The class also has a few getter and setter methods that return values and set the x and y coordinates respectively The class also has methods to calculate distances between two points ( both an instance and class method is present to calculate the distance) The class also a method for garbage collection which can be called in the Test.java class for forceful garbage collection
Point() - Constructor for class Point
Constructor that initializes the instance variables to 0.0
Point(double, double) - Constructor for class Point
Constructor that initializes the instance variables
pointID() - Method in class Point
PointID method that basically returns the ID of each of the point created

R

remove() - Method in class Point
Method that basically does the Garbage collection

S

setX(double) - Method in class Point
Setter method that initializes the individual instance variable to the parameter passed
setXY(double, double) - Method in class Point
Setter method initializes both the instance variables to the parameters x and y together
setY(double) - Method in class Point
Setter method that initializes the individual instance variable to the parameter passed
